page.title: 18 DAILY LIFE IN KENNINGTON
page.content: On weekdays, working couples and school children wake between six and eight o'clock. As most people work Monday to Friday, the family is toge- ther during the evening, when they have a hot meal, and the watch the television together. Many of{KENNING- {TON'S}appliances are electrical, the electricity comes from the{NATIONAL {GRID.}During the day, families use many electrical appliances. Non-electrical things are: taps, baths, and the toilet. People get milk and letters delivered to their door for them. The normal number of rooms in a house is eight (including the landing/stairs),three bedrooms, a bathroom, a living room, a sitting room, and a kitchen. Many families live in an area that is residential, and the average{KENNINGTON}family consists of two adults & two children.
